ABNL is a 100% owned indigenous firm, with a shareholding in excess of 100 million Naira. Its&#39; directors are individuals of proven integrity, who over the years have acquired the requisite experience in the Oil and Gas business, as well as in the banking and finance sector. The integrity of the directors and the staff of the company have been a priceless contributive factor in the growth and wellbeing of the company.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Engineering - Instrumentation and Controls Lead III

Job Location:&nbsp;Offshore Platform, Akwa Ibom
Employment Type: Contract

Job Description
Main Functions:


	Define the scope of all pre-commissioning and commissioning activities, assign workloads, review and implement standards/procedures, including man-hour estimating, cost estimating, budgeting, and progress reporting for the Instrumentation scope for all phases of the project.

	Assist in the Design, Review and Approval of Instrumentation related engineering deliverables, i.e. instrument indexes, installation details, location drawings, datasheets, wiring drawings, loop drawings, P&amp;ID&#39;s, material requisitions, evaluation of alternatives and selection of instruments, calculations (control valve, flow elements, pressure safety valves), document control logs, bill of materials and instrument change approvals.

Engineering - Instrumentation and Controls Lead III Job at ABNL Limited




        
    

        
        ABNL Limited was incorporated in 1992 as an Oil and Gas servicing company with a vision to provide professional engineering and technical services to the Oil and Gas exploration and production companies in Nigeria and the West African sub-region. Since its incorporation, the company has grown in leaps and bounds, expanding its business horizon, but still within the Oil and Gas sector.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



ABNL is a 100% owned indigenous firm, with a shareholding in excess of 100 million Naira. Its' directors are individuals of proven integrity, who over the years have acquired the requisite experience in the Oil and Gas business, as well as in the banking and finance sector. The integrity of the directors and the staff of the company have been a priceless contributive factor in the growth and wellbeing of the company.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Engineering - Instrumentation and Controls Lead III

Job Location: Offshore Platform, Akwa Ibom
Employment Type: Contract

Job Description
Main Functions:


	Define the scope of all pre-commissioning and commissioning activities, assign workloads, review and implement standards/procedures, including man-hour estimating, cost estimating, budgeting, and progress reporting for the Instrumentation scope for all phases of the project.
	Supports development and execution of centralized engineering services for existing upstream production operating units and new upstream capital projects to maintain safety, availability, and reliability of the instrument and control systems while optimizing cost.


Tasks and Responsibilities


	Liaise with customers, vendors, engineers, and other disciplines as required.
	Participate in HAZOP/ LOPA reviews and in other technical, constructability and quality reviews
	Assist in the Design, Review and Approval of Instrumentation related engineering deliverables, i.e. instrument indexes, installation details, location drawings, datasheets, wiring drawings, loop drawings, P&ID's, material requisitions, evaluation of alternatives and selection of instruments, calculations (control valve, flow elements, pressure safety valves), document control logs, bill of materials and instrument change approvals.
	Support project Acceptance Testing (AT) including: reviewing procedures, assigning resources, periodically attending AT, and adjusting commissioning scope to integrate AT successes and deficiencies.
	Develop, track, and adjust commissioning execution schedule.


Skills and Qualifications


	Previous experience in a closely related position and/or supervisory experience in a related field
	MS or advanced degree in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or related engineering specialty, or equivalent professional experience
	Extensive knowledge of discipline design standards, specifications, codes, and appropriate safety criteria
	Able to review, evaluate, and update cause and effect, P&IDs, logic and architecture diagrams and control narratives
	Experience in selection, application, and ISA data sheet specification of hardware, including pressure/ temperature /level instruments, control valves, shutdown valves, and fire/gas detection
	Proficient in data collection and analysis with common database and software data analysis tools such as SAP, Analytics for Excel and Tableau
	Ability to adapt to tight deadlines, heavy workloads, and frequent changes in priorities
	Proficient in the Microsoft Office suite of software programs
	Read, write, and speak fluent English, especially as it applies to technical and business communications.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resumes (must be in MS Word format) to: jobs@abnl.net using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Vacancies at Goldchek Herbals
content:
Goldchek Herbals is a herbal producing and sales company created to solve daily health challenges of her clients. Here we offer you quality,assurance,authentic and lasting solutions. We are professional to the core.

We are committed to revolutionizing the Herbal industry by prioritizing health and wellness above all else. Founded with a vision to redefine the standards of Herbal products, we specialize in offering a comprehensive range of health-enhancing solutions that cater to the diverse needs of our consumers.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Online Sales Representative

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Description


	We are seeking a highly motivated and results-driven Entry-Level Sales Executive to join our growing sales team. This role is focused on generating sales entirely through online channels, requiring proactive customer engagement, effective communication, and excellent follow-up skills.
	The ideal candidate will manage client interactions from inquiry to conversion, ensuring customer satisfaction, repeat business, and a smooth online experience.


Key Responsibilities


	Engage with customers across online sales channels (social media, website, WhatsApp, email, etc.).
	Make follow-up calls and maintain consistent communication with prospects and existing clients.
	Convert online inquiries into successful sales through persuasive communication and relationship building.
	Handle basic customer complaints and provide timely solutions to maintain client trust.
	Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, transactions, and feedback.
	Collaborate with the operations and marketing teams to improve customer experience and sales strategies.
	Meet and exceed individual sales targets.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND / SSCE.
	0–1 year of experience in sales, customer service, or telesales (experience in online sales is an advantage).
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Strong interpersonal skills with a customer-focused attitude.
	Ability to work independently and within a team.
	Basic knowledge of CRM tools, spreadsheets, and online communication platforms.
	Must be proactive, organized, and target-driven.
	Candidates must reside within Surulere or nearby areas.


Compensation


	?60,000 monthly salary
	Attractive commission on sales performance.


Application Closing Date: 30th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: eziakuoutsourcingfirm@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

	We are seeking a highly motivated and results-driven Entry-Level Sales Reps to join our dynamic sales team. This role focuses on generating sales primarily through online channels, requiring proactive customer engagement, excellent communication skills, and strong follow-up ability.

	Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, transactions, and feedback.
	Collaborate with the operations and marketing teams to enhance customer experience and improve sales strategies.
	Meet and exceed individual sales targets.

	Minimum of OND, SSCE.
	0 - 2 years of experience in sales, customer service, or telesales (experience in online sales is an advantage).
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

	Basic knowledge of CRM tools, spreadsheets, and online communication platforms.

Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: eziakuoutsourcingfirm@gmail.com using “Sales Reps - (Sales & Customer Relations)” as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Accountant

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos (Hybrid)
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Mode: Hybrid
Preferred Gender: Female

Job Summary


	Our client is seeking a competent and detail-oriented Account Officer to support the finance function through accurate record-keeping, financial reporting, and effective management of daily accounting operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain and update financial records in accordance with company policies.
	Prepare financial statements, budgets, and cash flow reports.
	Manage accounts payable and receivable processes.
	Reconcile bank statements and monitor all financial transactions.
	Generate periodic management reports to aid decision-making.
	Collaborate with internal teams to ensure financial compliance and efficiency.

	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related discipline.

N150,000 Monthly plus applicable benefits.

title: Job Openings at Powerex Limited
content:
(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    

Powerex Limited is a reputable company that provides electrical and power services in Nigeria. With our team of competent staff, we serve our clients by combining good customer service with sound technical skills. Our responsiveness and professionalism uniquely endear us to our growing clientele. We appreciate that high-quality power availability means a lot to your business, which is what we are set to ensure. Your electric power concerns are safe in our hands; you may confidently go to sleep. You would find our partnership more rewarding than you thought. We are focused on strengthening relationships with our customers and leading global solutions vendors, ensuring that we continually provide cutting-edge technology solutions with the highest quality of service delivery, exceeding our customers' expectations. We welcome you to our world where we attentively listen to and appreciate your needs, and are always willing to meet and exceed your expectations cost-effectively and efficiently.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Field Service Engineer / Technical Support Officer

Job Location: Gwarinpa, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	To provide technical support services for troubleshooting, repair, and maintenance of Automatic Voltage Regulator (AVR), Uninterruptible Power Supplies (UPS), and related equipment, while ensuring adherence to internal quality control standards.


Responsibilities


	Participate in daily toolbox meetings to align team objectives and HSE protocols.
	Perform assessment and routine inspections on facility generators, AVRs, UPS units, and other electrical infrastructure.
	Troubleshoot and repair electrical and power system faults, including the replacement of components such as capacitors, boards, and cables.
	Conduct field visits to client sites for fault calls and inspections, documenting observations and taking corrective actions.
	Ensure safety and proper configuration of electrical installations, including server rooms and office outlets.
	Support infrastructure maintenance, such as power outlet installations and gate automation systems.
	Communicate technical findings and service needs with internal teams and external clients.
	Liaise with HR and administrative departments for official documentation and personal record updates.
	Maintain accurate records of repairs, components used, and issues encountered.
	Ensure appropriate power systems and solutions design with simplified drawings.
	Service level agreement (SLA) implementation and monitoring.


Education


	 Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering.


Experience:


	Minimum of 5 years of experience.


Other Requirement:


	Candidate must be willing to travel.


Skills:


	Proficient in UPS systems troubleshooting and repair
	AVR diagnostics and component replacement
	Electrical and electronic fault detection
	Spares identification and technical part matching
	Workshop repair procedures
	Quality control and assurance testing
	Problem-solving and root cause analysis
	Time management and prioritization
	Technical documentation and reporting
	Client communication and professional conduct
	Adaptability in dynamic field environments
	Collaboration with cross-functional teams (inventory, procurement, repair units)
	Multimeter and diagnostic tools
	UPS testing equipment
	Soldering tools and repair kits.


Application Closing Date: 29th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@powerex-limited.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Technical Sales Engineer / Business Development Officer

Job Location: Gwarinpa, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Technical Sales Engineer/Business Development Officer is responsible for identifying business prospects, developing new business, and developing strategies to drive business growth and expansion in line with the organization's objectives.


Responsibilities


	Sales, marketing, and promotion
	Customer relationship management
	Bids/tenders
	Reporting and documentation
	Business expansion
	Proposal and contract management
	Revenue growth
	Market analysis and strategy development
	Any additional duties and responsibilities as assigned.


Requirements


	Degree certificate with at least 5 years of experience.
	Proven track record of success in business development within the power engineering or related industry, with product knowledge of UPS, AVR, industrial controls, and energy storage systems
	Strong understanding of business trends and market dynamics.
	Expertise in building and maintaining relationships with high-profile clients


Skills:


	Exceptional leadership and team management skills.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities.
	Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with clients and partners.


Application Closing Date: 26th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@powerex-limited.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Front Desk and Administrative Officer

Job Location: Gwarinpa, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The job holder plays a crucial role in maintaining the smooth operation of the organization.
	They serve as the first point of contact for visitors and clients, while also providing administrative support to the organization.


Responsibilities
Reception and Front Desk Duties:


	Greet and welcome visitors in a friendly and professional manner.
	Maintain a clean and organized reception area.
	Assist visitors with sign-in procedures
	Handle inquiries, take messages, and forward them to the appropriate recipient.


Administrative Support:


	Manage daily correspondence, including emails, letters, and packages.
	Organize and schedule meetings, appointments, hotel bookings and travel arrangements for staff.
	Maintain office supplies, inventory and place orders when necessary.
	Monitor usage of consumables (e.g., toner, stationery, cleaning items).
	Assist with the preparation of presentations, and other documents.
	Prepare periodic administrative reports for management review.
	Manage internal logistics including meeting rooms, reception duties, and mail.


Record Keeping and Data Entry:


	Maintain and update contact lists and databases.
	Organize and manage physical and electronic files, ensuring easy access and retrieval.


Customer Service:


	Provide exceptional customer service to clients, ensuring their needs are met.
	Address complaints or direct them to the appropriate person for resolution.
	Coordinate and communicate effectively with internal teams to ensure seamless service delivery.


Facility Management:


	Coordinate repairs, cleaning, and maintenance of office buildings and equipment.
	Liaise and supervise utility service providers (e.g, plumber, electrician, cleaners, security guards, drivers, welder etc.).
	Ensure fire safety measures and compliance with health and safety regulations.


Vendor and Outsourcing Supervision:


	Ensure service level agreements (slas) are met and issues are escalated and resolved timely.


Staff Welfare and Office Coordination:


	Monitor and maintain a clean, professional office environment.
	Support welfare needs such as lunch room arrangements, sanitation, and utilities.
	Assist with planning and organizing events, meetings, and conferences.


Skills and Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 3 years of experience.
	Proven experience in a front desk or administrative role
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel etc).
	Interpersonal skills and a friendly demeanor
	Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Time management skills and multitasking abilities.
	Excellent written and verbal communication.
	Basic understanding of procurement and asset management processes.
	Knowledge of facility management and office operations.
	Integrity and discretion with confidential matters.
	Detail-oriented and organized
	A team player with a positive attitude and willingness to learn.


Application Closing Date: 26th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to: careers@powerex-limited.com using the Job Position as the subject of the
